intro: Cynometra oddonii, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, elongated fruits containing several seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and timber, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
